posts.post_content:
Ah Thrun, the card that every color hates. ![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol) can't cancel it, bounce it, or control it, ![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol) can't bolt it, at best it's a life engine for ![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol) with lifelink cards, ![White](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=W&type=symbol) can't arrest or tap them, and all ![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol) can hope for is to trample over him or play the same card. Ironic that the color of the deck that plays him is the most common method to get around him. His only weakness is flying creatures, but [Angelic Destiny](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Angelic Destiny) solves that little problem.  
  
He's not unkillable and vulnerable to several cards in other decks, but Thrun shrugs off most of the combat tricks of all decks. At a low cost. And can be buffed by you or allies. He's extra fun with lifelink. No green deck should be without it.  
  
Edited as I forgot white.
posts.html:
Ah Thrun, the card that every color hates. can't cancel it, bounce it, or control it, can't bolt it, at best it's a life engine for with lifelink cards, can't arrest or tap them, and all can hope for is to trample over him or play the same card. Ironic that the color of the deck that plays him is the most common method to get around him. His only weakness is flying creatures, but Angelic Destiny solves that little problem.

He's not unkillable and vulnerable to several cards in other decks, but Thrun shrugs off most of the combat tricks of all decks. At a low cost. And can be buffed by you or allies. He's extra fun with lifelink. No green deck should be without it.

Edited as I forgot white.

posts.post_content:
@J\*\*\*Aurelius  
  
Elf Combo with [Heritage Druid](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Heritage Druid) and [Nettle Sentinel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nettle Sentinel)  
UG Madness  
Zoo/Naya  
Doran Rock  
Ghazi-Glare  
[Vengevine](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vengevine) Survival (pretty much banned [Survival of the Fittest](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Survival of the Fittest) singlehandedly)  
Jund  
Eldrazi Ramp  
Valakut (don't let the Mountains fool you, this deck is almost mono-green)  
Wolf Run Ramp  
  
Green has definitely had its fair share of dominant decks over the years. It might seem hard to get broken with green, but the color has plenty of cards ranging from powerful to decidely ridiculous, including [Tarmogoyf](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tarmogoyf), [Wild Nactal](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wild Nactal), [Knight of the Reliquary](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Knight of the Reliquary), [Lotus Cobra](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lotus Cobra), [Fastbond](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fastbond), the aforementioned [Survival of the Fittest](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Survival of the Fittest), [Oath of Druids](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Oath of Druids)...the list goes on.  
  
On top of everything else, it is arguably the strongest color in the Commander format due to its sheer quantity... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: GrimjawxRULES (11/6/2011 4:57:51 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
You know, my old comment, which I put up right after Thrun was spoiled, mentioned that when [Mindbreak Trap](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mindbreak Trap) rotated out, we were going to have some very sad blue or a lot more [Wall of Frost](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wall of Frost)s. And then they went and didn't reprint [Wall of Frost](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wall of Frost) and just made me look like a tool. :p  
  
This is, in my opinion, everything a legendary Mythic should be. Combine a 4/4 body with 4 CM regenerate, and uncounterable, and you've got a solid, solid card. Slap on troll shroud and give him some awesome art and flavor and you've got yourself a mythic. At the same time, getting him doesn't mean you've won; it just means you've likely just secured a strong position, which makes him perfectly balanced. Easy 5/5 for power, style, and execution.
posts.html:

This is, in my opinion, everything a legendary Mythic should be. Combine a 4/4 body with 4 CM regenerate, and uncounterable, and you've got a solid, solid card. Slap on troll shroud and give him some awesome art and flavor and you've got yourself a mythic. At the same time, getting him doesn't mean you've won; it just means you've likely just secured a strong position, which makes him perfectly balanced. Easy 5/5 for power, style, and execution.

Posted By: shmewdog (7/21/2011 4:58:44 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: @emperorerror: Yes, "can't be countered" means that trying to use a counterspell such as [Cancel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cancel) or [Essence Scatter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Essence Scatter) will have no effect on Thrun ([Mindbreak Trap](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mindbreak Trap) however, which technically exiles and not counters a spell, can hit Thrun - kind of like how [Swords to Plowshares](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Swords to Plowshares) can remove indestructible creatures. Same with [Time Stop](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Time Stop)). Hexproof only applies while on the battlefield, it doesn't prevent countermagic.
posts.html:
@emperorerror: Yes, "can't be countered" means that trying to use a counterspell such as Cancel or Essence Scatter will have no effect on Thrun (Mindbreak Trap however, which technically exiles and not counters a spell, can hit Thrun - kind of like how Swords to Plowshares can remove indestructible creatures. Same with Time Stop). Hexproof only applies while on the battlefield, it doesn't prevent countermagic.
